intro: Limosella monticola, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and North America. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale pink, blooming in the summer months. Limosella monticola is adapted to cold climates and has a compact growth form to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually succulent, helping to retain moisture in arid or high-altitude environments.
